trans-unit.source: Implements a type converter for converting <xref href="System.Double"></xref> (used as the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom"></xref>) to and from other types.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.ZoomPercentageConverter"></xref> class.
Converts the <xref href="System.Double"></xref> (used as the value of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom"></xref>) to an object of the specified type.
<xref:System.Windows.DependencyProperty.UnsetValue> may be returned to indicate that the converter produced no value and that the fallback (if available) or default value should be used instead.
Pass `null` for `parameter`.

This parameter is required by the signature of <xref:System.Windows.Data.IValueConverter.Convert%2A>, and is used by some implementations to provide contextual information to the converter; but it is not used in this class.
The current value of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom"></xref>.
The type to which value is to be converted.
This must be <xref href="System.Double"></xref> or <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
`null`.
The language and culture assumed during the conversion.
when the converter cannot produce a value; for example, when value is `null` or when targetType is not or .
\- or -
The new <xref href="System.Object"></xref> of the designated type.
As implemented in this class, this must be either a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> or a <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
If it is a string, it will be formatted appropriately for the culture.

Returns a previously converted value of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom"></xref> back to a <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that can be assigned to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom"></xref>.
The data binding engine calls this method when it moves a value from the binding target to the binding source.
<xref:System.Windows.DependencyProperty.UnsetValue> may be returned to indicate that the converter produced no value and that the fallback (if available) or default value should be used instead.
Pass `null` for `parameter`.

This parameter is required by the signature of <xref:System.Windows.Data.IValueConverter.ConvertBack%2A>, and is used by some implementations to provide contextual information to the converter; but it is not used in this class.
The object that is to be converted back to a <xref href="System.Double"></xref>.
The type of value.
This must be <xref href="System.Double"></xref> or <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
`null`.
The language and culture assumed during the conversion.
when the converter cannot produce a value; for example, when value is not a valid percentage when targetType is not or .
\- or -
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> representing the zoom percentage of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref>.
